author: {'steamid': '76561198050024852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1484242252}
review:
I'm rather disappointed, the devs can't even seem to stick to the 'lore' they've come up with for this thing, the description states that the game 'puts you in the shoes of a high schooler who gets transported back in time into the body of a [b]Samurai[/b]. [b]However, in this timeline, [u]all[/u] the Samurai are inexplicably [u]female[/u].[/b]'

Upon playing the game until the whole time travel thing and finding out that the character really hasn't changed at all apart from his outfit, the description is misleading.  If all the samurai are supposed to be girls, then the dude should be in a girl's body as well, but this is not the case at all.  I'm glad it's free for the first chapter, because I don't like being lied to, and while I may play a bit further through the game later to see where it goes, at this point I'm not sold on the rather expensive 'DLC' and will probably not buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1487121821}
review:
ChuSingura46+1 S is a visual kinetic novel with japanese anime graphics.  It worked on Win 10, sounded good, played good, looked good.  I am only reviewing / playing the Free part. The free part of this title is you get the first episode and the VN program free, so this is a teaser for the 4 paid episodes.  The story was mostly understandable, with few spelling and grammar mistakes.    Was a good many hours plus of reading.  Story was like a modern person travelled back 300 years to take part in history of the 47 Ronin story, with a modern anime spin on it.  Story was sort of strange at times, a drama movie mixed with an anime. The artwork was great, had animated parts, sound FX, several background music pieces that set the mood of the scene, many voiceovers in japanese.   Much use of scene transitions, animation, visual effects.  

Didn't see any hentai, so if you looking for that only, might be disappointed. There is No Gallery of pictures, so you have to take screenshots if you find something interesting. There was no choices, that i could see.  Many main male characters shown as cute  girls or sexy older females depending on the emotions of the character or plot.  Much clevage shown with some headlights on.  The story ends at a good stopping point.

The UI is simple but not as clear as other VN.  I had to hunt around how to stop the auto mode, so i could save and stop. And the background music volume need to be set halfway or off in the options before you start playing, BM drowns out the voiceovers and sound FX.  Auto Skip don't work?

Try it, if you like Visual Novels.  Check other reviews for info about the paid portions of this VN.
Might want to buy this on a deep sale, it was expensive for just one set of 2 episodes ($17.99).

For more info:
no spoiler = review
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f39ydKnrBaI

author: {'steamid': '76561198115989380', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1483353600}
review:
再別特區 

续志膜

轻轻的我膜了，
正如我轻轻的续， 
我轻轻的挥手，
作别西方的记者。 
那河畔的蟾蜍，
是夕阳下的长者，
波光里的赛艇，
在我心头荡漾。
寻梦，撑一支长篙，
向蛙声更深处漫溯，
满载一船经验，
在闷声发财里赛艇，
但我不能赛艇， 
赛艇是暴力的续命。 
特首也为我沉默，
沉默是今晚的特区。 
轻轻的我膜了，
正如我轻轻的续， 
我提一提腰带， 
不带走一秒时间。

author: {'steamid': '76561198203910545', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1857, 'last_played': 1483234534}
review:
The story's good. It's free, just try it.
Chapter 1 has marginally better translations, so I wouldn't bet on consistency here.
Chapter 2 and 3 suffers from basic grammar errors (e.g., "i" is not capitalized or use of "me and this character").
Chapter 4 and 5 can become intolerable due to scrambled translations (you can really tell the quality is dying off). Censorship aside, it's okay because the first chapter's free anyway. 

Buy the first? Love it? Buy it. Like it just a little? Ditch it. 

If you want a comparison to the Japanese release, simply turn any semi erotic scene into an uncensored one. The scrolling and the right enter key actually work as well.
Most importantly, chapter 3's one and only choice isn't an instant death flag red button and actually does something.

TL;DR: sketchy translations in DLC, but good  translations in the first chapter.
Buy moonrunes edition for better transitions and ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

author: {'steamid': '76561198087597370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3635, 'last_played': 1483295960}
review:
Short review:

If you have any interest at all in Japanese historical drama, play the free chapter, even if you don't care about anime babes. Beware of semi-serious translation issues in the paid DLC.


Long review:

I'm incredibly conflicted about this game.

Let's get this out of the way first: If you're here for titillation, you'll be disappointed. Despite appearances, this version of ChuSingura is pure story with zero hardcore content. But the experience is all the more worthwhile for it.

The story and characterizations are fantastic. If you have a pre-existing interest in Japanese period drama, this game will scratch your itch like few others before it. If you don't have that itch, ChuSingura may very well create it for you. The art varies in quality, with backgrounds being decent at best, but where it really counts — character design — the art is nothing short of excellent. The Japanese voice acting is good enough that each of the 40+ (!) voiced characters in the story take on their own unique personalities. 

However, there's a serious problem: translation quality and editing. This problem is not apparent right away, nor present all the time, but it worsens as the story proceeds. By the fourth and fifth DLC chapters, entire portions of the story are barely more than nonsense gibberish. That these sections are interspersed between blocks of sensible, well-formatted and edited text makes it all the more frustrating. The project was clearly split between multiple translators and editors of vastly different levels of skill and care. Some portions are terrific; some feel like they were put through Google Translate and copy-edited by a grade schooler, if at all.

The story and characters are so captivating that the translation issues never prevented me from wanting to continue. The sheer quantity of content is also massive for the price. Each chapter in ChuSingura is equivalent in size to most other visual novels, though that's partly because the writing is padded and falls into some of the bad VN tendecies of over-describing things that are readily apparent. Still, this is the first time I have spent 60 hours on a VN with a single coherent narrative as opposed to various "routes" that don't relate to one another. In terms of scope,  ChuSingura is equivalent to an epic saga of novels such as the Song of Ice and Fire, back to back to back.

This review, much like my own perspective on ChuSingura, seems stuck between positives and negatives. That's unfortunate, because I enjoyed ChuSingura immensely and truly wish I could recommend it without reserve. To that end, I strongly urge the developers to dedicate a translation checker and editor to fixing up the latter portions of the paid DLC. If they could raise the quality level of the worst sections to match the best sections, ChuSingura would be at the very top of my list of visual novels.

Until that time, I give ChuSingura a double thumbs-up for the free portion and a single thumb up for the paid DLCs. Despite its drawbacks, ChuSingura's story and characters will remain with me for a long time to come.

I enjoyed the ride.

review:
An amazing reenactment of the Ako incident and Chushingura story in a modern way.

Pros:
+ The plot is very enjoyable and allows the reader to immerse into the Edo period of the feudal Japan. 
+ The characters are well developed, having unique personalities. Some of the scenes do an incredible job in evoking emotions.
+ The art and visualization are detailed and smooth, providing the necessary atmosphere for the plot.

Cons:
- The music sometimes is very annoying.
- The port doesn't look very "passionate."

Overall, 9/10.

review:
heres my problem

author: {'steamid': '76561198065776960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1481900912}
review:
the first chapter was good, but the replayability isn't as much good in the later chapters. and it gets boring pretty easily. the biggest problem with time travel and looping is that it had to poorly follow the events that happened in history, with a little bit of modifying some bits here and there, but not truly utilizing this advantage of being from the future. In the end the MC pretty much lived by the rules and customs of Chusingura era. the "gimmick" dies down fast, and what you have is just as what it is: history that you have to read multiple times in the further chapters while adding very little to the overall plot. it is truly very much skippable.

With that said, MC has big issues. he came from the future, yet his moral compass is just as low as these uneducated ronins. I can no longer count how many times I've been facepalming whenever the plot tells him to be timid. for example in chapter 5 (Emoshichi route, where I am currently reading), [spoiler]He never told his supposed mother to get an effing job because her family is poor. nope, blame it on MC that the kids that got scammed when they were delivering opium. [/spoiler] Or that [spoiler]Sayo not telling the Chamberlain that she is just Grim Reaper. She "killed" her own father, and now her sister and brother are walking to the path of death and destruction. no, you have to be that little kid that gets easily manipulated by Death herself.[/spoiler]

So yeah, can't really recommend the subsequent chapters. just play the first chapter. that's the only part it is good, and its free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007850719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5088, 'last_played': 1535237742}
review:
This is a kinetic novel that is a rewrite of the classic Japanese tale of the 47 ronin.
+
Very good art work
good quality sound
Great rewriting of a classic story
Long (each DLC is as long as a bogo standard VN/KN)
-
The last two chapters have some translation issues (at the time of writing this review)

At first glance its just the 47 Ronin with women with big breasts (which would be good in itself), but when you actually experience the novel you soon find it has been well thought out plot wise and also allot of care and attention has been put into the production standards. It has a good quality feel to it with voice acting throughout and high quality art
The developer has been clever using the fan service to get a much loved story moved back into the limelight, making it accessible to the disaffected Japanese youth and as a side effect opened it up to the western markets as well (although the localisation and 'all ages' conversion has lost quite a bit from the original). The translation is pretty garbled in the last two chapters and needs to be reworked. 
The strong starting story, solid rewrite, good plot and well... lest face it, giant breasted sword swinging female samurai, makes this well worth your cash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011397557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1481398007}
review:
The original story and all is good enough, but this is the worst translation and port you could find being sold anywhere in history of all things. And taking in the fact that the translation gets exponentially worse AFTER the free chapter, this is truly disgusting. It's not "wow there's a lot of typos" level of bad, it's complete loss of readability level of bad. Starting from chapter 3, it's extremely apparent that a lot of scenes were just given to different people, or were not finished. The start of all chapters will be relatively fine, and then you'll get to one new scene and you will be hit in the face with the QUALITY suddenly shooting off. Notable example is the scene in chapter 4 where dual sword girl is tied up, an important and serious scene that gets completely lost.

As for the port, it's some unbelievably bad unity ""engine"" that has ridiculous issues such as:
-The common "voice playback cut off on click" option does NOT stop voices when a new one comes up, so they just queue up, simply baffling.
-The backlog menu does not close on any input other than clicking the small X in the corner. The simple fact that it doesn't close upon right clicking, ESC, or scrolling to the bottom, is a clear indication that whoever made this port doesn't give a single shit.
-Some sliding animations of sprites will take a ridiculous amount of time and can't be skipped, a few sound effects will burst your ears, options are severly lacking, backlog gets cleared at every new scene. It's just bad.

And sure, censorship is bad and all. But it's really disappointing that it's the only negative point being taken out of this garbage.

Unless you're just another tard going after anime boobs on steam, I strongly advise against buying the dlc chapters. Don't support this kind of hack job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039020640', 'num_games_owned': 2211, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 4140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4009, 'last_played': 1480809921}
review:
Como VN, ChuSingura no posee rutas ni elecciones, te limitas simplemente a apretar el botón izquierdo del mouse o la tecla Enter para pasar los diálogos, y eso es todo. La interactividad es mínima. No sería tan errado afirmar que se trata de un libro con agregados visuales y sonoros, o de un anime con ilustraciones estáticas.
Sin embargo, este título es el perfecto ejemplo de que una buena historia es fundamental para cualquier juego (que aplique una narrativa en su mecánica). 
La reinterpretación de hechos históricos (muy libre por cierto, pero con buena carga de datos verídicos) esta muy bien planteada, con buenas dosis de humor y bastante emotividad, y fluye sin problemas durante las mas de 50 horas que te tardas en terminarlo. En adición, el apartado sonoro (tanto la música como las voces) son excelente, como así tambien los BG y el arte en general.
Vale aclarar tambien, como en cualquier Eroge que ha sido ajustado al formato All-Ages, Censura-chan esta presente en el juego. Y si bien es fácil notar cuales partes fueron removidas o editadas y en que momentos debían aparecer, no afectan a la forma en la que la historia se desenvuelve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3471, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1479801476}
review:
ChuSingura46+1 S ist ein Visual Novel (Japanisches Adventure) dessen erstes Kapitel kostenlos bei Steam gespielt werden kann, die weiteren Kapitel muss man sich als DLCs dann kaufen. Das "Spiel", besser der interaktive Roman/Comic behandelt die berühmte japanische Geschichte der 47 Ronin aus der Sicht eines jungen Mannes der während einer Sonnenfinsternis in das entsprechende Jahr in der Geschichte zurückreist besser gesagt sein Verstand in einen Mann dieser Zeit versetzt wird. Soweit so interessant. Die Geschichte wird ganz ordentlich erzählt, die Bilder sind gut gezeichnet, wenn auch natürlich im Manga Stil, was hier aber durchaus passt. Was mich irritiert ist das man die historischen Samurai (die als Ronin dann berühmt werden) als junge halbnackte Mädels darstellt. Ich hab nun wirklich nichts gegen vollbusige halbnackte junge Damen. Aber was soll das hier? Muss das wirklich sein? Letztlich wohl Geschmackssache. Als Visual Novel an sich, finde ich es gut gelungen und einer der "besseren" Vertreter des Genres die ich bis jetzt gesehen habe. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xKIC9_UKseM

author: {'steamid': '76561197994035358', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 23954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16530, 'last_played': 1569186874}
review:
ChuSingura is a great and entertaining game, at least in my opinion. It kept my interested enough to spend quiet a bit of time to read through its 5 chapters. And i would like to see more of this franchise. I would definitly recommend this game.

BUT sadly there are some counter points to consider:
- It is a VN, so there is not much Player-interaction. If you don´t like VNs in general, this game isn't for you.
- While the Game itself is good, it is sadly censored, which is not neccesarly a problem, but i don't like it, and it made it a hard decision to pay for the additional chapters for me.
- The translation itself is not overall good, especially in some parts its rather poor.

In the end, i would still recommend this game, though i still hope that we someday  get a better translated and uncensored version.

Until then though, this is the best we have, and its still a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142575780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1480201073}
review:
Très bon jeux :D .

Les graphisme/dessins sont pas mal ^^ .

author: {'steamid': '76561198031994154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1479692673}
review:
A very solid VN, but also a very very japanese VN. I honestly dont feel at "home" with all the seppuku and samarai mind-set at the core of the story. Everybody seems to be dreaming of a violent death soaked in blood and honour, and they do so for reasons that I do not really comprehend. To make these hardened warriors, whose only dream is to die a grousome death by the sword for their masters, into loli girls does not really make the story easier to swallow.

Highly recommended for fans of traditional samurai-drama, not quite as much for the rest of us, but still a good read at an affordable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999629349', 'num_games_owned': 2195, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1324, 'last_played': 1479614974}
review:
Chusingura46+1 S - Chapter 1 - Free version
To begin with, I have to say this is a great VN game; that tells the story of the 47 Ronin of ado perfectly. Even so, I am sorry to say that, I don't know so much from the original story, only the basic, since I watch a movie with the same story called, 47 Ronin from 2013, if you have not watched that film you really should.

But when all that said, it's not all good, I have some problem with it first the menu, the menu is fine, but I feel like it could have made a little better.

I don't like the music in this game; I had to turn it off because it killed my mood in this game and it didn't feel right.

The thing that pisses me off is they have squeezed the big O is, so it looks like a Zero 0, and it was not something I could ignore, because it was clear as day, and it was every big O that look like it.

If you click skip, so all text is showing at once, then sometimes there is too much text in the text box, and you can't go up and down, and that pisses me off because then I have a hard time reading it.

If you don't know the story of the 47 Ronin and how Japan was in 1701, then this NV game can be confusing at First. I have to say I had a hard time, to begin with, but the longer I got into this game, the easier it got to follow.

Something I have noticed, is sometimes they call you She, and other time the boy, I don't know if this is a translation error or just some oversight, but I got confused at a time if I was a male or a female, even if everything says I was a male.

There was also some spelling errors and grammar mistakes and some word that didn't belong like a bad google translation or something.

But besides all that, I really love this NV game, and I will buy the other 4 chapter when I have the money to do so, so if you love Japan history, and love VN games, and don't mind use 14 hours or so on this lovely game, then I would recommend it 100%, I would personally give this NV game 7 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045944746', 'num_games_owned': 1478, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 9485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3574, 'last_played': 1590275849}
review:
You know what? As a person who generally doesn't really "do" visual novels, once I got past some of the more fan-servicy bits and the occasional sloppy translation ("huts like hell..."), I think that this actually has a really engrossing story. So here I am, giving it a positive review. I know, I'm shocked, too.

Edit: Finished the game and liked it enough to make a mini-review video (no spoilers):

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f39ydKnrBaI&index=2&list=PLYvIDs595mMidYnjy0lpW39C6SnwPp9C0

author: {'steamid': '76561198201255289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1725, 'last_played': 1662087764}
review: I had heard of visual novels and how fun some of them could be, but I was blown away at how epic the story was. I had run into the original story of the 47 Ronin during a research project for an English class, and I really liked how this game took the story and made it where the characters and their personalities could be related to. The main game with the Chamberlain route was fun, and gave a great preview of the full story, but if you want to get the most enjoymentof out this game, I highly recommend getting the DLCs for Chapters 2&3, as well for Chapters 4&5. The story's twists and turns will keep you on your toes for what will happen next (like it did for me!). The story is nice and linear, but there is one instance in Ch. 3 (spoiler alert!) where you make a choice. Once again, I HIGHLY recommend this game to both people who have played visual novels, and to people like me who have heard of them, but never played one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079302409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1477438710}
review:
the game is one of the best visual novels i have ever seen! it constantly keeps you intrested wanting for more since it has the wonderfull story of the 47 ronin with a touch of harem (no ecchi stuff) involved in it since most of the samurais are females and even if you know the original story and how it ends its progression always makes you wonder if they will follow it or not. If i had a complaint it would be the price of the next chapters (DLC) which i find a bit expensive only because its a novel and its play time in numbered since its storytelling and not interactional in order to play different routes and stuff, although its duration was filling (14hours). i probably wont spend the amount of money to get the rest of the chapters and i am dying to know what happens next but still i reccomend it even if you only play chapter 1 like me. 

IF you are really into novels and plan on getting the dlc's too i Highly Recommend it because of the well-made characters and its great story..!

P.S!!! the tag nudity is BS probably people added it cause of some sideb00bs resulting from some a bit more skin revealing samurai outfits so if you are into that dont check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287660587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3371, 'last_played': 1498105685}
review:
Итак пройдя всю игру (НАконец-то!) Могу полностью описать все что я чувствую (Внимание дальше спойлеры).
Поначалу начав читать данное творение мне казалось что это будет очередной унылый роман коих очень много. Однако я рад что этого не произошло. По факту разработчики сделали историю по типу аниме Re:Zero, где главный герой начинает всю историю сначала после своей смерти.

По этому в данной игре мы видим происходящие события с 5-ти разных сторон:
1) Повествует нам о Ониши Куроносуке, которая как многие думали являлась главной фигурой в истории по убийству Киры. Но что же ее, желающую жить мирно сподвигло на это?
2) Повествует о Хорибе Ясубе, самом радикальном персонаже во всей истории, которую главный герой поначалу не понимал (Ибо она презирала Куроносуке). Однако ощутив всю ту боль и страдания что испытывали остальные Ако ронины, его мировозрение становится еще жестче (Это отчетливо видно когда он не задумываясь отрубает руку телохранителю Киры)
3) Повествует о дочери Куроносуке Матсуноджи. Честно это пожалуй единственная история которую я осиливал до начала конца. Ибо её характер между 1,2 не сильно отличались, а в 3 просто перевернули с ног на голову. НО! Концовка реально вышла шикарной. Хотя все концовки цепляют за сердце.
4) Нежданчик! Но мы теперь с телохранителем Киры, которая каким то чудесным образом попала вместе с нами в наше время и теперь чтобы не помереть заранее мы отправляемся вместе с ней в прошлое.

Ладно. Так все не поместится. В общем +:
+ 1-я истроия бесплатна, то есть пройдя ее сами решите брать или нет
+ Второстепенные персонажи здесь раскрываются ничуть не хуже (а порой даже лучше) главных.
+ Сюжет. Если начало в каждой истроии поначалу вызывает скуку, то в конце вы не можете оторваться от прочтения (словно от хороше книги)
+ Кому важно тут есть фан-сервис. Причем даже без кат-сцен (Грудь Ониши чуть ли не из кимоно вываливается. Фува даже при разговоре светит набедренной повязкой. Ясубе время от времени демонстрирует свое тело при купании, а Матсуноджи по моему не носит лифчик и т.д)
+музыка здесь хоть и однообразна но не раздражает и порой подсказывает что сейчас начнет происходить экшен, шутка или важный разговор.

В общем для меня это не было тратой времени и денег

author: {'steamid': '76561197965065599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1392, 'last_played': 1476942088}
review:
After playing, I googled the 47 Ako Ronins, and it's seems to be based on that story :)

Enter the world where the main samurai characters are female instead. Although, this is only the first part I played, the story was very interesting and it draws you in. The characters in the visual novel is cute and kawaii as ever, which definitely gives some game hype and humor. They also have wonderful voice actors for this VN. The art style is perfect, and the music compliments the visual novel very well emotionally/atmospherically. The plot will draw you in to keep continuing with the story.

Although game tags say it contains nudity, it doesn't. It's more ecchi, and it can be positive or negative depending on different people's experiences. I believe the game is completely fine as it is though. 

The visual novel does not have choices to choose. It would be more interesting if choices were given, but then I believe it would kind of stray from the story of the 47 ronins.

Now I want to buy the other parts/sequels to the visual novel o_O

author: {'steamid': '76561198312330004', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4459, 'last_played': 1622958290}
review:
WARNING SPOILERS.    This was my first visual novel I have ever read. I thought I'd give it a try it since it was free. I did have my doubts, I love anime but I never really got into manga(weird I know) so I wasn't really confedent in this novel when I first got it. 

After I finished the first chapter of the of the novel, I was counting the days for the next chapter of the this novel because of how Romantic, Unusual, and the Action that I saw in this amazing plot. I love the characters such as the Chamberlain for her funny momments and romantic momments. Yasubee and Fuwa were fun to watch. I love Suguha and how he deals with his situation and how he becomes a bad-ass as the whole story progresses. Each ending of a chapter puts me at the edge of my seat. 

I say the same things to all of the other chapers like Edo Radicals, because it was awesome that Suguha loved Yasubee. Chapter 4 however left me asleep because of everyone talking back and forth all the time. I know thats how it is in the other chapters, but in those chapters the characters talked about subjects that progressed the story. Chapter 4 puts the whole story to a stand still and I actually left I the middle of a pointless conversation. The only part that was important were the 2 new character siblings that both that have suffered a tragedy. 

The final chapter however, absolutly blew it away. It started off being like chapter 4 with nothing but talk, but after a little bit of time the story progresses purfectly. I also loved how Suguha became a mastermind to turn the tables on the villian. 
The final battle was amazing with the war over the skeleton army and the main characters ghost. I LOVED Suguha's final battle as he battles the main villain for the people that he cares for. 

To be honest Suguha is the best part of the story. Not just because of the main character, but you see him develop from a highschool wimp to a epic bad-ass hero (and a woman's man). 

The music was amazing, the artwork is awesome. The story is mind blowing, Suguha develops beautifully. 

If you like visual novel with a little bit of everything, check this one out. I do recommend paying for the DLC it is totally worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120348301', 'num_games_owned': 1313, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 7507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2898, 'last_played': 1483825500}
review:
Well, I never thought that a visual novel with a lot of fanservice could be this good. This is a kinetic novel (no choices, you only read), fully voiced (also the VA is great!!), with a nice art style and good BGM. This review is only about chapter 1, and I’ve not played this game before, so please keep that in mind.

I loved this VN. At first I thought it was only about dem boobs but the story is really interesting, the characters are amazing, and some scenes actually made me cry (especially towards the end). There’s some what the f*ck scenes to please ecchi fans, but there’s a lot of character development and history too. At first I also disliked Suguha, but wow, that boy grew up [b]so much[/b]. I’m excited to read the next chapters, but I don’t think they can beat this first one. It was truly amazing.

8/10, give a chance to this title, after all, the first chapter is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103916465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2296, 'last_played': 1488066948}
review:
Das meiste was ich positives zu dem Spiel zu sagen habe, wurde schon in anderen Reviews erwähnt, ich spreche aber direkt eine definitive Empfehlung aus. Daher versuche ich mich möglichst kurz zu fassen: 

Wen abschreckt dass es sich hier quasi um eine Kinetic Novel handelt (keine Entscheidungen, sondern quasi ein Buch im VN Stil lesen), der soll sich solange er VNs mag bzw. gut geschriebene Bücher & Storys, bitte davon nicht abschrecken lassen. 

Während die Story manche lockere Comedy-Elemente enthält, ist dies hier sicherlich nicht das Hauptaugenmerk und etwaige Klischees in den Comedyszenen fand ich nicht störend sondern passend- der Großteil der Story findet in der Zeit einer Variante des alten Japan statt.  Genauso wenig sollte man davon ausgehen, dass es hier Fanservice mit schwacher Story bzw. Verniedlichung von allem gibt, da man die Ako Ronin weitestgehend gegen Frauen ausgetauscht hat. (Die nächsten Sätze dazu werden etwas repetitiv.) Natürlich ist es Fanservice die Ako Ronin etc. als Frauen darzustellen, aber anders als man vermuten könnte rückt dies öfter als nicht in den Hintergrund und alles wird immer wieder sehr ernst und spannend. Oftmals wird die Situation also durch diese "Änderung" aufgelockert und natürlich gibt es dadurch einige Klischeehafte Szenen die man so aus Anime kennt- dennoch: Die Story steht 100% im Vordergrund und ist detailliert und klasse wiedergegeben, die Klischees sind wirklich nur zwischendurch eingesetzt und tun der ganzen Sache keinen Abbruch- alle Charakter sind auf ihre Art und Weise klasse und beweisen im Laufe der Story Entwicklung und (emotionale) Tiefe. 

Ich gebe zu dass ich anfangs auch etwas skeptisch war- da das komplette erste Chapter (locker ~10 Stunden) kostenlos ist, kann sich hier aber auch jeder selbst ein Bild machen. Anfangs wirkt die Story wie nichts besonderes und auch nicht wirklich ernst- wer dem ganzen aber etwas Zeit gibt, wird bald eine Story entdecken, die einen nicht mehr so einfach loslässt. Der Protagonist durchläuft über alle Kapitel ebenfalls eine stetige Charakterentwicklung- seine Ansichten & Ziele ändern sich gleichermaßen wie seine Fähigkeiten und mentale Verfassung. Fantasy-Elemente gepaart mit Geschichtlichen Fakten der Genroku Era, sowie Zeitreise-Elementen, ausreichend Action/Kampf-Szenen, Drama und durchaus etwas Mystery versprechen zu unterhalten. Dazu kommt, dass sich das ganze erst nach und nach entfaltet- kann man die Geschichte ändern? Wieso konnte es überhaupt zur Zeitreise kommen? Wieso gerade der Prota und wofür? Kann ich wieder zurückkehren- wenn ja wie und ist das wirklich von Dauer... Will ich das am Ende noch? 

Es ist schwer nichts ohne Spoiler zu schreiben, jedoch sollte gesagt sein dass die volle Story in 5 Kapiteln erzählt wird und alles ein Großes Ganzes bildet. Und wenn man denkt es könnte fertig sein, dann geht es gerade erst richtig los. Artstyle, Musik, Japanische Synchro, sowie Storytelling und Charakter sind alle klasse geschrieben- gebt dem ganzen eine Chance und vielleicht wird das hier einer euer Lieblinge des Genres ;)

P.S: Die Musik ist von der Lautstärke nicht wirklich ausbalanciert- ihr hört sie auch noch laut genug wenn ihr sie auf 10% stellt, ansonsten übertönt sie womöglich den Dialog in den falschen Momenten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009450953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1475815371}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051804871', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 11429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3567, 'last_played': 1633467705}
review:
One of the best stories I have read. I felt all the emotions, it's truly a great story, by it's not really a game, as the only (two really, but the second one is really much of a choice) choice in the game is to continue the story at ones own pace. Don't get me wrong I love this story, but this game is not much of a game, rather a story book in digital form, so if you are buying this, just know you will not get any (but one which cause gameover) choices their can effect the story.

I played it again... still pretty good, even if you skip some parts. Well you get something for you're money, thats for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150051068', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 7535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5723, 'last_played': 1551617319}
review:
My very first visual novel. I don't think I will ever find another VN which is as good as this one. Apart from the ecchi parts(because there is quite a lot of those :D) both the art style and the audio of the game is awesome. The voice acting is superb. The whole plot is based on real historical events so you won't just read an awesome story but you will learn some Japanese history as well. I actually looked it up and not only the events match with the game's plot but even the characters' names as well. And there are some parts when they're talking about old Japanese things like money and the measurment for distance and land. So all in all this VN doesn't only provide you with a heartbreaking story and a really happy ending but some actual facts as well. This is a perfect example for learning while having fun. So if anyone that loves animes/mangas/VNs and is interested in Japanese history(and loves boobs) this VN is a must have. 10/10 would read again 1000 times.
PS:As I mentioned there are quite a lot of ecchi in it. And the final chapter is spent with Yatou Emosichi who is a litle girl. I guess you know what I mean. Chapter 5 is ful of loli. So any loli fans out there... have fun ;D
Edit: I've re-read the story. Even reading it for the second time it hasn't lost its charm. Inre did a really good job making this VN.
New edit: I've found out that there is actually another ChuSinGura VN which continue the story of this one however it hasn't been translated to English yet and there are no sings that it ever will be. The only thing we can do is hope that it will get translated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046353792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3757, 'last_played': 1588788186}
review:
Bon... Pour faire simple : Ce jeu est génial. 
Si vous n'avez pas peur de claquer un peu d'argent sur un visual novel ou qu'ils sont en soldes, n'hésitez pas à acheter les DLC pour obtenir les 4 autres chapitres du jeu.

Pour faire moins simple : 
Un scénario profond, avec de nombreuses références historiques et autres clins d'oeils sympathiques.
Une bande son utilisant souvent des instruments traditionnels japonais, pour augmenter encore plus l'immersion.
En plus, elle est excellente et très bien coordonnée pour l'ambiance.
Les personnages sont très attachants, voire parfois trop (Difficile d'avaler la mort de certains).
Le développement des personnages laisse très rarement à désirer, mais quand c'est le cas, ça signifie généralement qu'il n'était pas si important, donc c'est pas grave.
Et honnêtement... CE TWIST AU DERNIER COMBAT DU DERNIER CHAPITRE !!! (Sans vouloir spoil, vous comprendrez ce que je veux dire avec "m***e, c'est pas parce qu'ils n'avaient pas assez de budget en fait !" quand vous saurez qui est le "grand méchant" et ce qu'il a fait pour que le héros danse dans la paume de sa main)
En plus, toutes ces théories sur l'histoire sont plutôt passionantes (Je trouve personnellement que l'Histoire est une matière très ch***te, mais là j'étais franchement sur le c*l)

review:
Eine tolle Visual Novel mit einer unglaublichen Geschichte. 
Die Story ist so traurig und zugleich lustig, spannend, und einfach nur schön.
Für jeden dem eine gute Story wichtiger ist als spielerische Freiheit ein absolutes muss!

Das erste Kapitel ist eh kostenlos daher probiert es aus und ihr werdet nicht wiederstehen können.
Die DLCs dann unbedingt kaufen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995321994', 'num_games_owned': 1521, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 5726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1554171441}
review:
ChuSingura 46+1 S is a visual novel developed by Inre. For those new to this concept, visual novels are interactive games that have very few choices if any at all. The concept might seem boring, but those interested in books ChuSingura is a jewel among VNs. It is also one of the games that will make you think of your own life and wonder what would you do different if you could travel back in time?

The main protagonist is Fukami Suguha, an average Japanese student that ends up transported back in time during the Genroku era in 1701 CE. The story essentially deals with the 47 Ronins and their plans to avenge their lord unjustly while also restoring the family’s honor. It is a story of courage, bravery, romance, mystery, magic and duty. 

The game is excellent when it comes to provoking emotions in the player thanks to the amazing special effects used when the samurai are fighting with their swords, the music and the imagery. Some moments will be so touching that the player will shed tears. 

I personally did not encounter any bugs with the game, but there were some minor translation errors, although nothing major.

Each chapter of ChuSingura is excellent and so far I played the 3 released. I think it is worth giving a try considering the fact chapter 1 is free for everyone and chapter 2 and 3 are bundled for 20$. Each chapter deals with the same story but someone else’s perspective as well as different events. 

Overall, I think ChuSingura is one of the best visual novels I’ve read and I would gladly recommend it to anyone (heck, first chapter is free, so why not?). I give the game overall with its dlc a 9.5 (lost 0.5 for the minor translation errors). It is a must have in your collection.

So this is basically the famous japan story of the 47 ronin who avenged their lord and blah blah blah, but the slight difference that in this case they are all female because of "(plot)-(plot) reasons [strike] no one would even bother to check it if were otherwise.[/strike] Mind that there are fantasy elements similar to the movie of the same story which came some years ago.

Ejem* Naturally, there is a slight amount of fanservice, not a big deal annyway,[spoiler] or it is?.[/spoiler]

The first chapter is free and it have a very acceptable duration to introduce the first and probably most important part of the story, is a great oportunity to go and try if you are into Visual novels, i asure you if you get into it, the ending will result so cliffhanger, i`m looking for the others chapters now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997753928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 6349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4546, 'last_played': 1494921687}
review:
People looking for smut will be disappointed with ChuSingura since Steam had it neutered, and people that like a quality story will overlook it thanks to the rediculous overly large breasts with obligatory nipple outlines screaming that this is, at face value, an unsophisticated smutty game. But it proved otherwise.

Since all that's left is story and gratuitous fanservice, It's a suprisingly witty adventure with incredible plot twists, tragedy, and good humor. And seriously.. Best selling point is it's free. Why, I certainly dont know. Maybe its their way of compensating viewers for eventual boob-blindness.


The DLC could use some graphical and translation fixes, but the next 2 chapters were worth the cash despite suffering from numerous such errors. The length of these chapters is no joke.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149834241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1469524375}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998859782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2918, 'last_played': 1588271183}
review:
First off, this is NOT a game.
It has 0, ZERO, interactions needed (except 1 time in chapter 3) from the person reading this.
It is however a damned good visual novel, even if it obviously had the more "adult" parts taken out due to Steam's policy.

TLDR:
If you like Visual Novels, this is a "SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!!" buy.
If you don't know if you like visual novels, get Chapter 1 anyways, IT'S FREE.
Then you'll either go "Not my thing." or "SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!!"



I'd highly recomend anyone who want to try out or are wondering if visual novels is something for them to get the first chapter since its FREE. 

The story revolves around the 46 named Ronins and one Ronin which historically is still ambigious and depending on the research you look up, either counts or discount that last participant. Which is a nice touch since in this VN, that last Ronin is you, time traveled from mordern 21st centuary. 

This is one of the things that stood out to me. 
That this VN is actually quite accurate historically not just with names and locations, but also referencing ancient units of measurement from distance to time and hour of the day.
The fact that all the Samauri involved are now mostly boxom women or cute lolis *matters not!*
most of the actions that they took as told in Chapter 1 can be crosschecked against historical records and studies. 

Minus one tweeny event at the end. (Look up East Asian Myths "White Snake" Japanese Variant)
Liberties are of course taken. :)

There are enough twists, turns and story perspectives going from Chapter 1 (free) to Chapters 2 and 3 (1st DLC) that if the first chapter had captured you, by the time you end at the current availble chapters (2-3) you will be wanting chapters 4 and 5 with "SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!!" mindset.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002353572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3056, 'last_played': 1477138269}
review:
Not too big into VNs usually since I don't see the appeal. I saw the first chapter of this one up for free and was impressed by the production quality of the CGs and was kinda bored so I gave it a try not knowing what to expect.

Ended up binging through all of it during the course of a few weeks. I think the reason is that this VN is less about choices (there's a grand total of 1 so far which just bad ends you) and romancing. It's just a straight story.

The pacing, world / character building and atmosphere in the VN totally hooked me in. Each chapter is essentially a new loop through the same basic set of events, but you get to genuinley experience it all from a different prespective and tone each time which was really cool. You can tell that the writer wanted to make the most out of the ground hog day premise to make sure that it didn't get too boring or perdictable. Each chapter does a very good job building up the stakes anew which culminates in very powerful scenes near each ending. And the really cool thing with the writing in my opinion is that even with only 3 of the 5 chapters, you still get what would be a pretty strong conclusion to the story by chapter 3, so I definitley feel like I got my money's worth here. The last two chapters feel like they'll just be tying up a few loose ends so I don't mind the wait.

The only sore spots with this VN mainly lie in the translation quality. I could mostly look past it and just fill in the gaps myself but there's a decent number of grammer errors and typos that indicate that chapter 2 and 3 were rushed to meet the deadline. If waiting longer means we get a more refined translation for the next 2 chapters then again, I don't mind.

Overall I definitley recommend giving the first free chapter a try to see if this might be your thing, and I am looking forward to the last 2 chapters!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014831291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2055, 'last_played': 1641983823}
review:
Just finished chapter 3 and wanted to write a review.
So... where to begin with? Maybe with the minor negative points:
Its not really a game, because you can't influence the story. (one minor decision).
Maybe its only on my computer, but sometimes there is a bug where the character displayed is way bigger than the screen. Fixed by reloading the picture.
And especially in the 3rd chapter, some english mistakes. (like spelling "I" (for me) like "i", or sometimes repeating some words)
BUT: Its a beautiful story about a timetraveller going back to an alternative 17th century japan, living by the side of samurai girls getting revenge for their unjustifiedly killed master. 
I was actually sometimes crying because of the depth of the emotion of all the characters.
The Artwork is breathtaking, and I haven't seen so stunning manga artwork for long.
The sound is exactly what it needs to be, enough suttle not to disturb the story but to improve it.

Well, I can't really discibe how awesome that it is, but I recommend everyone who likes to read and is able to understand english or japanese, and maybe is a bit interested in japanese history to download this game. Can't wait for chapter 4 and 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198072803543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 11578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6227, 'last_played': 1476808574}
review:
Stop cutting material from the whole. It's not fair to the consumers or content creators to leave out segments. Paying for an incomplete version just leaves me with a bad impression, which sucks because this was a great read.

 I like the pay structure, 1 chapter free and dlc 2 and 3 if you really enjoyed it you can continue.

But seriously, if I liked it enough to BUY it. It truly isn't fair to cut or forceably censor an art piece when I know what I'm getting myself into.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993402400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1787, 'last_played': 1472440885}
review:
I have never played a visual novel before this one.  I've been mildly curious about them, but never enough to shell out any actual money.  So when this one popped up on my radar as being FREE, well hey, I'm willing to risk that kind of money.

I took a look at the Steam page and said "Man, that looks a little fan-servicey".  And normally that's the kind of thing that would turn me away from a product.  But "FREE" was the key word here, so I figured "What the Hell?" and downloaded it.

And it turns out that it's pretty good.

I thought I was getting "Baywatch Nights", but set in Edo-era Japan.  I figured I'd watch it for 30 minutes, maybe an hour, and roll my eyes a lot.  Instead, I got "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon", plus cleavage.

As I say, this is my first visual novel ever, so I dunno how it compares to any other visual novels.  But it was very enjoyable.  Very compelling romance/adventure story with some genuinely moving scenes.  I've already ponied up for chapters 2 & 3 and look forward to reading those, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044198152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3827, 'last_played': 1620093906}
review:
Fantastic visual novel with a great story.  Don't bother playing/buying if you're only looking for knuckle ammo as there is no 18+ content, though if you do get off to fully-dressed cartoons... well, whatever toots your whistle...   The story alone is enough to have me on edge waiting for second DLC to drop, chapters 4/5.  

And yes, I had a tear or two at end of chapters 1 & 2, and had more than a few at near-end of chapter 3...
Watch chapter one!  If you have any interest whatsoever in the samurai genre, even if you've never heard of the 47 Ronin, Read This Visual-Novel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038743618', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1472246056}
review:
7/10 

This is a retelling of the 47 ronin. A modern day student goes to an alternate past where many of the 47 ronin are women.

This type of visual novel has zero choices. It is 100% railroaded. Some might be inclinded to pass on this vn because of that, but you may want to still give it a shot since the first chapter is free. 

Truthfully, the quality of this VN is high tier. The animation, story, writing, and music are above the average. There are definetly reasons to laugh and cry in this game. I'll probably pick up the DLC chapters, but there are other vns I'd rather take a look at then continue this right now.

Each chapter is roughly 10 hours of play each.

Note there are no H-patches for this game. The publishers don't intend to release one, but this doesn't really take away from the game as it is still complete without it. You're missing out on 11 H scences over 5 chapters and loli slapstick which I'm glad to be without. *you will not find an english version of this game anywhere with the H-scences*

Download chapter 1, see how you like it. Don't bother searching for H-patches, they don't exist and aren't needed. If you like chapter 1, you'll want to buy the dlc for 2-5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030408286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 2371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1463, 'last_played': 1476912417}
review:
At first, all you'll see is your stereotypical heavy cleavage, Japanese themed visual novel. Which it is, but at the heart of a cheap marketing tactic lies something of a hidden gem.

Protagonist is a bit of an arse at first, but develops as time goes on, which is unusual.

The story is genuinely interesting (unlike most VN's with a heavy focus on how the women look), with unexpectedly likeable and interesting outlooks on life.

Really unlikeable antagonists (always good).

The only downfall is, actually, too much focus on the cleavage/semi nudity, because it cheapens the experience. Because the story's so good, this would have been better without it.

Definitely get this if you like VN's.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163506372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1531, 'last_played': 1484083041}
review: Certain visual novels draw you in, entice you to read on with abandon, unable to truly detached from the characters and story even when you are away from the screen.  ChuSingura is one of those events, having now completed all three chapters I am vacant not knowing when our journey will recommence.  Each chapter takes between 10 – 11 hours to complete, so allot of content is covered and this makes the novel fantastic value.  The art style is nice, the game appeared to flow without glitches for me, and, although the ‘story’ remains similar in each chapter, the journey you are taken on differs significantly in each play through.  I cannot wait for the next chapters to be announced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990425293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3985, 'last_played': 1487586817}
review:
This visual novel is basically about a talented protagonist that has lost his desire to nurture his own talent in Kendo, then coincidentally gets transported back to a time where pride and honor are still important qualities of a swordsman. He is forced to go through many hardships, but then tragedy strikes and he was given another chance through time traveling. Beyond this is major spoilers, but let's just say that he struggles mentally because of this 'curse'. He goes through hardship and self-loathing, and yet he seeks to save those he cared about; but at the same time, seek for salvation. A journey where his personality constantly changes depending on the new experiences he continues to go through, while looking for a way back to his own time. 

The first three chapters was the struggle, and the last two chapters can be considering the turning points of the story. I honestly think the first three chapters could've stood on it's own, but it is still good to see a continuation of the character's interactions in the last two chapters.

The first three chapters covers three of the four girls with their own romantic routes. The forth is the revealing chapter that gives us the answers. The last chapter is the last heroine and the finale. I won't say which chapter belongs to which heroine, so you'll have to find out yourself. This VN has an enforced playing order, so you cannot choose whose route you can play first.

Personal visual novel score: 8.3/10
https://vndb.org/u40815

Known length of Visual Novel: Over 50 hours

author: {'steamid': '76561198041450198', 'num_games_owned': 1065, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 4540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4117, 'last_played': 1585130501}
review:
ChuSingura46+1 S is an game that plays in a mysterious time in japan.

You where just a normal student but then the fate grabs you and you awake in the past.Now your in the role of Suguwa Fukami what will the fate hold up for you ?
Will you return to the modern time or even find your love of your heart ?
You will see it in the good desinged 5 Episodes of this game.

The graphic is mostly drawn and it's really good.
There are non fan support things in it and it even don't need it thanks to this really good story
One Episode will take around 3-9 hours and there are 5 of it.

I recommend this game because of its beautiful story to anybody.
[b][10.3/10] Points[/b]

[spoiler]The Story would continued but the next game isn't out yet.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198311759625', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1475125886}
review:
刚打开游戏就被深深的吸引了...................
玩了一会儿，发现更喜欢了！！！
但是.......
为什么没有汉化？
为什么？
为什么？
即使如此我也要用爱去完成这款游戏！
    话虽如此，但还是有些难啃啊，男女之间轻松欢快的桥段还看得懂，反派之间长篇幅的阴谋论述就让我摸不清头脑了...一定是因为一堆男的说话让我的大脑没有动力去自动识别英文并翻译，对，就是这样。
虽然这款游戏没有成就系统也没有卡片系统，但是绝对是良心之作，如果你的英语水平比我这个只过了四级的人高，那么相信这款游戏一定不会让你失望。
     9/10  没有汉化必须扣分！

author: {'steamid': '76561198064031065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 7288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7287, 'last_played': 1655642921}
review:
一開始以為是單純爛大街的穿越及改變歷史的古裝劇，後來發現是一篇很長的歷史穿越輕小說，雖然開頭真的有點無味，不過隨著劇情跟角色的建立，慢慢會發現其中的用心，慢慢會沈溺在其中而有點忘記時間。

內容主要在描寫步入承平時期的日本幕府，各封建領主間為了一致的利益關係，惡意謀害出產高價鹽埔的赤穗領主，使得赤穗家臣流離失所，不僅喪失了領地封邑，也失去了武士的尊嚴，最終因未來毫無方向性而內部嚴重分裂。

礙於細節複雜也不想嚴重劇透，大致上，一至三章在描繪武士道精神的沒落，儘管君死臣辱，武士卻不再伴隨主君同生共死，幕府本身亦不允許武士隨意自裁，失去領主的武士或成為浪人、販夫走卒、賣酒女、教席、抑或是選擇貧困而死，真正的武士精神不為社會需要，人們只關注表象，忠義赴死僅成為茶餘飯後的話題，以及演變為江戶人民對幕府不滿的洩憤工具，而本作忠臣藏的故事，便是在這樣的時代背景下孕育而生。

說來，本作在配角方面非常多，整體內容也很豐富。免費的第一章非常長，你看很快應該也要看十個小時的時間，真的是非常佛心來的!

優點
+配樂跟幾首主題曲都是神番級的佳作，水準非常高。
+除了主角本身以外，基本上語音全配。配音員水準也很高。
+劇情完整，角色很多卻沒有遺漏角色的描寫，不過主要伏筆都埋在DLC二三章當中，第一章比較偏忠臣藏改編。
+雖然是偏向歷史劇忠臣藏的改編，不過二三章之後，主題開始截然不同，很多別出心裁的地方，給編劇一個讚!
+儘管戰鬥只有幾場，不過半動畫搭配文字描述還是蠻過癮的。
+除了歷史性的描寫，額外增添了古代日本文化的風俗以及各式生活的描述，讀起來蠻有帶入感的。
+故事時常涵蓋地點及戰略部屬之類的，這時候會有地圖標示及平面配置圖，可以感受製作組的用心。
+以對話為主，看起來不會像其他Visual Novels那樣沉悶，基本上偏向輕小說的寫法，但劇情卻比較嚴肅，卻又不會過於矯枉過正的感覺，在輕小說及歷史劇改編上給予了相當令人舒服的風格平衡。
+每一章節的故事風格都不同，例如第一章是半嚴肅半逗趣；第二章是沉重與哀傷；第三章是偏甜蜜與搞笑以及做角色更深入的鋪陳，同時主角的心境與劍技進入了新的轉折，不得不說，相當精采。
+角色畫得不錯，連許多路人女配角都畫得很有愛。不過只有巨乳跟貧乳兩種類型XD

缺點
-側繪有點崩，感覺像是不同繪師畫的。雖然側繪部分非常非常少就是了。
-沒有提供雲端存檔，要看完第一章才能看第二章，如果電腦重灌就可怕了，而且一些額外內容要看完第一章才會出現。
-只有英文跟日文。另外－因為我看英文版的關係，英文翻譯跟日文配音的意思時常對不起來，並且有很多非常冷僻的用法，還有很多神奇的字典翻譯，以及英文語法上的錯誤，有時候不知道對話在講什麼。
-屬於Galgame的選項都不見了，那就算了，DLC章節突然冒出選項是哪招?雖然有點驚喜就是了。

喜歡輕小說的人，應該也會喜歡這部作品，儘管需要一些日文或英文底子作基礎，不過非常推薦，那怕只看第一章也夠有愛了。

備註:本作是原本PS Vita的ChuSingura46+1跟V版本的移植作品，應該有刪減一些色色的劇情，所以標題是S，說來也有三年的歷史了，從2013年開始累積了很久到之後推出V，算起來是有點年紀的作品了。此外，也有關聯衍生的新撰組與忠臣藏的綜合故事，相當神奇。

author: {'steamid': '76561198039137828', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1470249829}
review:
[h1]ChuSingura46 + 1 S ist eine Visual Novel von Inre.[/h1]

Eins Vorweg. Dieses Spiel besitzt keinerlei Gameplay. Es gehört zu jenen VN´s, in denen man keine einzige Entscheidung treffen kann. Wer so etwas nicht mag kann hier bereits aufhören zu lesen.

[b][i]Story[/i][/b]

Alle die das nicht stört oder die dem Spiel dennoch eine Chance geben wollen können sich auf eine sehr gute Story freuen. Die Handlung basiert zu großen Teilen auf der populären japanischen Geschichte der 47 Ronin. Hier mal der [url= https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/47_R%C5%8Dnin] Wikipedia-Link [/url] für alle interessierten. 

Diese ohnehin schon sehr packende Geschichte wird sehr clever mit Fantasy und Sci-Fi Elementen (z.B. Zeitreise) vermengt und durch diese "aufgefrischt". Dass die Samurai überwiegend von weiblichen Charakteren dargestellt werden, hätte wegen mir nicht sein müssen, wird aber sicherlich den ein oder anderen männlichen Spieler dazu bewegen die VN zu testen. Zudem gibt es dadurch auch noch eine Liebesgeschichte die sich durch das halbe Spiel zieht und dem ganzen noch etwas mehr Spannung verleiht. 

Die einzelnen Charaktere haben alle eine ganz individuelle Persönlichkeit die auch recht glaubhaft vermittelt wird. Viele der Charaktere wachsen einem während der Geschichte dann auch richtig ans Herz, zumindest ging es mir so.

[b][i]Grafik[/i][/b]

Optisch macht das Spiel insgesamt einen guten Eindruck. Es gibt viele Hintergründe, die allerdings leider etwas detailarm sind. Da hätte ich etwas mehr erhoft. Allerdings gibt es zahlreiche Eventbilder (für die es leider keine Gallerie gibt) die dafür um so besser aussehen. Zudem sind die Charaktere sehr gut gestaltet und auch mit vielen Details versehen.

[b][i]Sound[/i][/b]

Vertont ist ChuSingura leider nur auf japanisch, was dem ganzen allerdings mehr Authentizität verleiht. Den englischen Untertitel fand ich überwiegend verständlich. Wer über normales Schulenglisch verfügt sollte im groben klarkommen. Die einzelnen Musikstücke sind gut gelungen, insbesondere jenes, das gegen Ende des 1ten Kapitels kommt macht Laune. Die einzelnen Sounds sind ansonsten auch ganz ok, schwanken aber leider etwas stark was die Lautstärke angeht.

[b][i]Fazit [/i][/b]

Insgesamt muss ich sagen, das ChuSingura eine der besten VN´s ist, die ich kenne. Allerdings darf man sie eben nicht als Spiel sehen, sondern eher als digitalen Comic/Manga/Graphic Novel. Wer sich für die japanische Geschichte im allgemeinen oder speziell für Samurais interessiert sollte sich dieses Werk unbedingt einmal ansehen. Gleiches gilt für Manga und Anime Fans und auch VN Freunde können ruhig mal einen Blick hierrauf werfen, schon allein weil das erste Kapitel kostenlos ist und mal abgesehen von den letzten 5-10 Leseminuten auch in sich abgeschlossen ist. Man benötigt also nicht zwingend die Folgekapitel. Ich habe zum durchlesen des kostenlosen Kapitels im übrigen gut 17 Stunden benötigt.

[quote]Wenn euch die Review gefallen/geholfen hat dann folgt doch unserem [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/8049466/] Reviewprogramm[/url] und wenn ihr mir etwas zu dieser Review mitteilen wollt dann schreibt gerne in die Kommentare.[/quote]

review:
人呐就不知道，志己也不可以预料。一个玩家的命运啊，当然要靠志我奋斗，也要考虑游戏的行程。我绝对不知道，我一个大作爱好者，怎么把我选到日呆游戏去了，所以G胖同志同我说，“蛤丝都决定了，今晚就由你来续！”我说另请高明吧，我实在我也不是谦虚，我一个普通玩家，怎么就给我推送日呆游戏了呢？但是G胖同志讲“大家已经研究决定了”，所以我就下载了这个游戏。

      很惭愧，就续了一点微小的1s，谢谢大家！

review: I am only on chapter 2 and OMG! This is only visual novel that has made me cry so hard. I could fill an entire glass of water with my tears. I cannot believe my eyes, there so much emotion in this visual novel it is ridiculous. I cried like a baby a in the first chapter, and the second chapter halfway through it made me cry. And the soundtrack, it is sooooo good. The only word I can use to describe the music is that is a one of a kind master piece. I won't say anything on the new chapters for spoilers and because this MASTER PIECE of a visual novel deserves the funding. It deserves every single dollar they ask for, as long it is not as ridiculous as activision with the DESTINY dlc's, they DESERVE and NEED the money. Master pieces like this one promise a lot. And for those who want a 18+ patch don't you guys worry, we will get it if we ask them enough times. This visual novel still has a long way to go so I ask for my fellow Ako Ronin, DO NOT LOOSE FAITH, WE WILL GET OUR BOOBS.

review:
This game is a really nice RPG game i would definately recommened. But i've noticed a problem with one of the texts Suguha use's once he goes back in time, on the 10th of January 1701. I'm going to quote it for you.

Suguha:
"Nothing...

I guess the term Spring's first south wind doesn't exist yet...
Phew, it's annoying how i have to be careful of the worlds I use."

I think the word is mean't to be word, but either way. Good game, i really love the background music and the feel for the game.
(I forgot to save this chapter and dont exactly want to go back until i've finished the first chapter. ;-; Someone please comment on this review if you go by a piece of text like the one above and say if they fixed it or not so i can remove this little segment of the review.) 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Found something else, not sure wherever it is a error or not, but later on the "It's almost been 2 months..." chapter, there's a sentence from Mansunojou that doesn't sound right.

Matsunojou:
"Then naturally, people tend to curry favor with me."

& theres one of Suguha as well later on

Suguha:
"Huts like hell..."

Jut thought i'd like to let you know as i play. Making sure to pay close attention! Thank you for the game aswell :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003751718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 14060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1509, 'last_played': 1552842923}
review:
Before trying the visual novel people should really look up on it's informaton for example on VNDB.

The visual novel has the tag of "Enforced Playing Order", that means any choices you made won't have any big impact onto the game's endings, like a kinetic visual novel basically. 

Technically you are reading a book from page 1 to page 100.  I don't particularly mind about this setting since I am someone who has played over 200+ Visual Novels. But it can sure be annoying to some.

The CG gallery and extras will be unlocked the moment you complete the game on the first chapter. There are several text bugs but they were patched out now by the Devs.

This is one of the best visuals novels out there in my opinion available in English, one words, Higurashi, and it is a very good one. The art is decent and the best thing about the game was the plot +  story. Also the fact that it relates to the real 47 ronins historical event so you can learn more about Japanese History.

The only downside in my opinion is that there are no 18+ content patch, sadly from what I've heard the devs stated they will not be doing this since this was ported from all age version. Personally I've played the Japanese version and have viewed almost all the H-scenes, we're not really missing much contents so its still decent. 

But it wouldn't hurt to have it to be honest. They can easily add that at some point in the future if they want more sales, it won't be too hard to just add an external link on their website outside of steam to do this.

Although there are several chapters, The first chapter is completely free as 1 Route so if you don't mind playing "Enforced Playing Order" visual novels do give this one a try.

Although this Visual Novel has some ecchi moments in it, don't play it for Nudity or Ecchi stuff   

Play for the Story/ Plot > Boobs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265170272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1469929822}
review: Not going to lie. I went in expecting this to be another hentai-style visual novel game. But what I got was a impressive twist on an old Japanese historical event with no sex whatsoever, and I am very okay with that. The characters themselves drew me into the story. I can't wait for the next 2 chapters to be released just to see what happens next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009396717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1469654170}
review:
Very enjoyable. I sat down and played for the full 15.3 hours on this Visual Novel without stopping and really read at an enjoyable pace to absorb everything (I don't like reading books if that says anything to ya). I normally don't play Visual Novels very much but this was well worth playing! I look forward to more of this quality or even a continuation if there will ever be one. 
All I can say is that this is an emotional rollercoaster if you like having "connections" with characters as well as love a good storyline -- then you've got to give this a play through.

Wonderful job on this -- I highly recommend.

The only con I could say would be a few keyboard stumbles on some words (about 4 or so words I think it was) but other than that, over the course of 15.3 hours, well done!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102795734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1471382900}
review:
Oh man.... This is such a great visual novel. While the shifting stills turn me off from time to time, the story itself is fantastic. [spoiler] I love how the MC isn't always just some invisible character as well, like many VNs like this.[/spoiler] It took me longer than I thought to finish, but it was definitely a good investment considered how much I loved the story. It almost makes you forget about the boobs. Almost. [spoiler] And now I play the waiting game for the newer chapters... [/spoiler]

[spoiler] P.S. if you read the spoilers (i.e. THIS), then you'd probably see that they're arguably not spoilers. To me, however, revealing any aspect of an experience best done on your own is what I consider a spoiler. I'm just here to input my two cents. Take it or leave it. Thank you for taking the time to read my rant. [/spoiler]

review: By far an amazing project. When I saw that there was only one chapter I was a little set off but I decided to try it and it blew me away. The one chapter alone provided hours of experience and was topped by characters with wonderful personalities and a story line with such great detail. I believe this one chapter alone could have been its own story but I am glad it is not. I am eagerly awaiting more and I hope this project is seen through to the end. I thank the creators and all who are working on it because it is tuly a masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113530727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1469323660}
review:
Great graphics, voices and characters, also great story line. Some of the music is good at times but it's mostly on and off with the music. Generally but other than that it's a really good novel to watch.


Edit~ This is a really emotional investing novel. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a story that can really get you into what's happening and allow you to actually empathize with the characters. The voices are slow but that doesn't stop the meaning or the emotional experience of the story. So check this game out if you are interested in such an amazing high quality story arch. 
Warning: You will cry!

P.S. You WILL be heartbroken.

P.P.S. I wish the story could continue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215841264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1469106466}
review:
点进来看见一片+1S，看得我都愣了，半天才反应过来的在下果然还是拿衣服。言归正传，忠臣蔵46+1是当年少有的硬派作品（虽然全员娘化了而且总会有意义不明的福利，可以，这很黄油）。整个故事取材于日本史上的三大复仇事件之一——赤穗浪士。游戏一开始是作为同人发售的，后来大受好评然后越做越红火（？）。原作分为五个章节，前三个章节都很棒，个人排名分别为主税、新八（什么，你居然不滋磁新八？来人，叉出去让他自裁！）、安兵卫、内藏助。不过STEAM这版本只有第一章的样子，暂且按下不表。后两章一路暴走，质量相比前三个章节逊色不少。（不过能艹到一学姐姐，那我就没有意见！这种金发狐狸女真是棒）。“忠”的优秀在于它的剧情。游戏时间能超过五十小时，作者用直刃的视（脑）角（洞）去描写了这起事件的各个人物。卧薪尝胆的大石内藏助，说到底也只是个希望孩子平安长大的普通父母；安兵卫等激进派（陆军马鹿）在寻求抗争不得又无法报仇的无力，迷茫，作为武士在没钱生活的现实面前的可怜的坚持（我可怜的阿初），又兵卫被伤了手臂无法参加复仇的落寞；主税作为正妻的成长以及对已经两次轮回，却依旧无法改变历史，只能不断轮回，陷入疯狂的直刃的包容；五右卫门家的小弟妹的日常生活；新八和一学姐姐的好棒好棒，以上。（嗯？我才没有漏说谁）
作品最大的遗憾是没有正面的打戏描写，而是采用各种“喝！”“哈！”“噼里啪啦”加上人物立绘的左右移动来演出，遗憾的不行，全程靠脑补。要是打戏描写能更加出色就好了。第二部《忠臣蔵——武士的鼓动》稍微好一点，和新撰组打得飞起来。（什么，你跟我讲不能艹新撰组？这我是不能接受的！）还有那个全员怀孕的结局是什么鬼啦，直刃被榨成人干了吧（笑）。画师虽然有时候比例很奇怪，不过我觉得对人物表情的刻画倒是蛮赞的，噗噗个噗。
目前第三部官网只能看到一张宣传图，居然还是第二部里出现的新撰组，在下表示大吃一鲸。照这样子，就是装逼了一整部然后被赤穗浪士吊起来打的节奏？

author: {'steamid': '76561198258565556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1467266897}
review:
[b]ChuSingura46+1 S[/b] est un Visual Novel où l'on incarne un étudiant qui se réveille quelques siècles en arrière, et qui tente de revenir à son époque tout en assistant aux événements qui forment l'histoire romancée des 47 ronins.

[u]Points positifs :[/u]
[list]
[*]Une histoire intéressante.
[*]Des graphismes soignés.
[*]Un côté pédagogique pour quiconque s'intéresse au Japon médiéval.
[*]Faire des samouraïs des filles sexy à gros seins.
[/list]

[u]Points négatifs :[/u]
[list]
[*]Un VN dans sa forme la plus simple : on clique pour faire défiler les dialogues, et c'est tout.
[*]La longueur de l'histoire, qui couplée au point précédent rend l'ensemble très rapidement lassant.
[*]Pas de nudité, d'érotisme ou de second degré...
[*]...et donc aucune justification pour transformer des samouraïs en filles sexy à gros seins...
[/list]

[u]Verdict :[/u]
Les points négatifs l'ont emporté. Je me suis lassé bien avant la fin du jeu. Dommage...

author: {'steamid': '76561198034502466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1470021056}
review:
I'm a History Major and Japanese history has always been a fascination for me. Yes this game is Fiction, and yes all of the samurai are women and yes the story is not 100% accurate but you know what? I don't care.

If you want a true idea of what it was like for the 47 Ronin who threw away everything they had to avenge their lord out of loyalty and honor then this is a good place to start. Don't watch the crappy 47 Ronin movie. Start here and then learn the true history because this game, despite being fanservice(Nothing wrong with that at ALL) is a good first step. 

I want to thank the creators of this game for putting me in Shuguha's shoes and giving me, an American, a first hand look at what it was like in Tokugawa Japan in the time of the 47 Ronin. This is a game that I think everyone should play if you like a good story, and like to be immersed.

review:
玩了一下午玩到了10月15日的情节，画面不错只是需要一直点击鼠标（当然你可以用回车，有时候回车比较方便）。
玩的时间我觉得够长了，因为一直在看剧情，没有什么特别出色的地方，之前看过动漫或者漫画的应该会比较喜欢吧。
适合死宅的游戏，无脑点剧情。
开始剧情不是很有意思，后来的剧情就比较有趣了。
个人不是很喜欢，所以不推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198103237376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1468807883}
review:
Not a game at all, but a linear "graphic novel" set in mediaeval Japan. All the warriors are women, and the Shogun is a little girl who likes to play with her dog. Apparently it's a retelling of a story known as the 47 ronin.

I haven't seen any nudity or sex, unless you count cleavage as nudity, which I don't.

Not recommended, unless you're specifically interested in Japanese history.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125147874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1468601360}
review:
ChuSingura46+1 is a visual novel about the 47 ronin, if those ronin would (almost) all be women and if there would be one man amongst them from the future, trapped in feudal Japan after a mysterious curse that somehow involves a solar eclipse and fortune cards put him there. So not really a realistic depiction of this historical event.

If you want to know if this VN is one for you, answer the following questions:
-Do you like slice-of-life elements and silly trope characters? Because that will be most of the story for the first half.
-Do you like loooooong VN stories? Because this is one of those.
-Do you like harem stories? And I mean the kind where every woman is attracted to you for no apparent reason once you give them even the slightest hint of attention or affection.

If your answer to any of these questions isn't a solid no, you have a fair chance of liking this game.

Pros:
-The shojo elements of the story are surprisingly good for a VN; the protagonist's choice to pick up the sword again, his training and the enemies he fights all feel natural and good. It would have been really easy for them to screw this up by making him overcome his adversity to swordfighting too abrupt or forced but they didn't.
-Some characters are good or likable and the roles that are too trope are either small enough for this to be understandable or not taken serious to begin with. This with the exeption of the daylight lamp.
-There are a lot more sprites than a free-to-play VN player like me is used to. Various outfits, little details, lots of expressions, and most of all the small roles. For not only the roles so small that they could've easily been written out completely, but also the insignificant characters like the Kira servants to get their own sprites is quite unique for the $0 VN's.

Cons:
-This is a completely kinetic story, no choices at all. I wouldn't mind this so much if they hadn't picked such an unusual choice to be your romantic interest, but they did.
-While I praised the shojo elements before, the actual action scenes are not really good. In between the sword fights that are pretty much just still frames with a vpunch effect and the sprites that are being moved around a little too much for too long, the action scenes actually felt like the slowest scenes in the story sometimes.
-This is more a minus to Japanese story telling in general, but the freaking flashbacks. If you're giving me a flashback of something they said literally just one minute ago, you're giving me the idea you see me as a 5-year old. The explaining of things isn't actually as bad here as it can be in other Japanese stories, but they give so many unneccesary flashbacks and repetition of dialogue.
